intro: Athanasia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed everlasting flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant is known for its long-lasting blooms, which remain intact for extended periods, contributing to its common name. Athanasia triloba typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
